title: connection error
body:
For about a week we cannot login to the game (from two different PC's that are connected through the same modem). After we enter the login and password we get a message "connection error, connection failure: unable to connect to the PVP.net server." We got this message several times about a month ago, then it disappeared by itself, and now it came back. We tried reinstalling the game, repatching it, and reinstalling .NET Framework 3.5. We use Windows XP professional.
What should we do to be able to connect again?

replies.body: so i had this problem for a few years and i never could figure out the answer, i could only figure out that it had something to do with the way my modem connected to the pvp.net server. best way to test if its your computer or your other equipment is to take your computer to a friends house and hook it up and play league for a while :3{{champion:19}}

Hey granddukeoflegan and everyone else!

Given that you are experiencing this issue on Windows XP (keep in mind that this OS is not directly supported anymore), but others are experiencing it on Windows 7, it does not seem to be related to your OS at all.

Typically, this error only pops up if something is not allowing your computer to establish a connection with our PvP.net Servers.  It could be due to an issue with security certificates or even due to another setting blocking this connection. Given the error message is pretty generic, make sure that you complete all of the steps in our [Login Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-Issues).  While these steps commonly fix these login errors, by no means am I saying that this is purely on your end; but at the very least it will allow us to rule out some root causes so we can narrow it down.

If this error message is still a constant source of despair, often causing a string of harsh statements directed at the client, then don't let it win this war just yet!  Make sure to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to one of our Tech Specialists so we can take a deeper look and get this resolved ASAP.  If you do submit a ticket, include these logs as well:

1) Network Analysis: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1

2) NetworkInfo Log: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4

3) Process List: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3

Also having this problem. Windows 7...

I've noticed a quick fix is to disable (apply) then re-enable (apply) SSL 3.0 in the internet options. Super annoying to have to do that ever single time I want to play, but it works for now. (Note this doesn't seem to work until you fail to log in once, sometimes doesn't work multiple times, sometimes works w/ disabling peer to peer xfers, sometimes works with re-enabling peer to peer. Idk. Its super annoying).

I would also LOVE to point out something super interesting here. I'm having this problem on two DIFFERENT computers, connected to the same network/router/modem. So it doesn't seem like it's something client based... Any help would be appreciated.
I have the same issue.  WIn 7.  Also, in game I get random - Attempting to Reconnect.
